Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2012 03:51PM Mooleen wrote: It would be a good idea. It has something to do with the fluctuating pressure in the airplane and it could start up Lymphedema. That is what I was told.
Posts.Title: Could These Symptoms be Lymphedema? mimikitty Binney4

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2012 12:21PM Mooleen wrote: I am 60 and today 5 weeks post op MX on my left breast. I am finally starting to feel human again. I had no lymph node involvement so no further treatment is needed. I originally had a biopsy/lumpectomy. It was DCIS level 3. They didn't get clear margins, so had a second surgery to remove more tissue. They still didn't get clear margins so a MX was then recommended. I am doing reconstruction with tissue expanders. I am glad I don't have to have radiation or take Tamoxifin. I am still a work in progress. All you can do is read everything you can I do what you feel comfortable with.
Posts.Title: Help! Lumpectomy taking the nipple. kem510 Worriedsickinpa

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2012 07:11AM Mooleen wrote: My BS did the same thing. After two excisions with no node removal I had a UMX. I was told he took 5 or 6 because they appeared swollen. When the path report came in it said 22. Even the BS was shocked. Apparently the surgeons can't really see them and the path report is the last word. I was not happy either because I now am risk for lymphadema. They all were clear so I was happy for that. The node excision was the most painful part of the recovery.
Posts.Title: Surgeon said 0/2 nodes, Pathology report says 0/16! DianaNM jacee

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2012 07:23AM Mooleen wrote: Removing nail polish used to be the norm because they watch for your nail beds to turn blue. With all the technology today, most drs wont require you to remove your polish. I think it is up to the anesthsialogist.

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2012 06:52PM Mooleen wrote: You should tell your surgeon/PS all your symptoms as they could all be related. You shouldn't be laying there in pain. You need to control the pain. Perhaps even an anti anxiety would be in order. Hang in there, it does get better but it takes a while. Let us know how your doctor appt. goes tomorrow.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2012 09:03PM Mooleen wrote: The pain under the armpit is from the node removal. I wish someone would have prepared me for it. I think it was the worst part of the MX. It is a burning pain. I couldnt stand any pressure on it so I took the stuffed breast form from my cami top and placed it under my arm for padding. It seemed to help some. It did eventually go away but it took several weeks. I know what you mean about not using your arm. I had a left mx and am left handed. It was frustrating because you automatically reach with your dominate arm.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2012 01:47PM Mooleen wrote: Usually when the doctor comes out and says no cancer they are pretty sure they know what they are looking at. It is when they don't say that you should worry. I came out of 2 lumpectomies/ biopsies and doctor said nothing to worry about. The third time he didn't say anything and I worried and was right to do so.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2012 12:04PM Mooleen wrote: It probably was a scam to begin with. So sorry.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2012 07:46PM Mooleen wrote: Trinity0723: I had weight lifting restrictions for 6 weeks of no more than 5 lbs. Even beyond that you need to be careful especially if you are having TE fills. You don't want your incision to open up. Trust me, for at least 3 weeks you won't want to lift anything. I couldn't even lift a pitcher of iced tea and it was frustrating because my UMX was on my left side and I am left handed so I would automatically reach with my left arm and the pain would remind me. Justegan: You have the most positive attitude. Keep it up. You set a good example for the rest of us.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2012 01:36PM Mooleen wrote: I am 6 months out from UMX. When i raise my arm, my armpit has a major cavity in it. Makes it really hard to shave. (I know, not supposed to use razors, but i am not having a bush under my arm. I am being very careful.) I assumed the reason for the cavity is the removal of the breast tissue and nodes. I still have an area below my armpit right about where the top part of the bra sits that is very sensitive. There is nothing you can see but it hurts when it is rubbed. Needless to say, wearing a bra is uncomfortable. I have been blaming that on nerve pain from the node disection. Has anyone else had this experience? Thanks.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2012 08:45PM Mooleen wrote: The nerve pain from the node removal was for me the worst of the pain. It wasn't excruciating but it was there all day long and the pain meds didn't help much. Like a burning sensation that noone told me about. It was from reading these boards that I figured out what it was. I used the breast filler from my mastectomy top as a cushion under my arm as I really couldn't stand anything touching and rubbing on it. The other pain was from the te sitting on top of the rib cage. I had a seroma on top of the te that made it worse. I turned the corner at the first day of the 4th week. Didn't really feel myself until after 6 weeks.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2012 04:54PM Mooleen wrote: What kind of electric razor do you use and does it really do the job? I have never used one.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2012 01:23PM Mooleen wrote: Justegan, dont get too hung up on what to wear after surgery. I did the same thing, because all of the clothes I normally wear accens the boobs. As it turned out I got 2 mastectomy camisoles (paid by insurance) and that is pretty much what i wore. It wasnt too long and i was able to get my tshirts on and wear my old clothes. I was glad I didnt spend a lot of money on stuff I normally would not wear and would never wear again.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2012 01:44PM Mooleen wrote: Wow, I was at the hospital at 7 am and out the door by noon. They did have a room for me overnight, but it went so well, I didn't need it. I have learned to ask the anesthesiologist for nausea medicine and have't had a problem with it since. I feel great, but like I told my kids, it might be the morphine talking. I took my Vicodin when I got home to stay on top of it. The most pain I am in is the sore throat from the anesthesia. I am anxious to see my new foob. I am concerned tha it might be too small. Will have revision surgery on the native side in Nov so I guess it can be tweeked then. I am one step closer to my final destination. Thank you all for your good wishes.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2012 07:53PM Mooleen wrote: I would suggest you see a breast surgeon for a surgical biopsy. I had implants and my tumor was very close to the implant, but it did not pose a problem for my surgeon.
Posts.Title: Mass on MRI -- Dr. does not want to biopsy but I do BlueSky5 Mooleen

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2012 07:56PM Mooleen wrote: I just started taking it for fibromylgia. You build up the dosage to 600 milligrams 3 times a day. When I reached the full dosage, I had major brain fog and sleepiness. I cut down the dosage to 300 mg in the am, 300 mg at 3, and 600 mg at bedtime. It is better, but still have a little fog and sleepiness, but I am going to hang in there and see if it gets better.
Posts.Title: Neurontin akc820608 akc820608

Posts.Content: May 2, 2012 12:07AM Mooleen wrote: It is not that bad. Only hurts for a few minutes. Kind of a burning sensation.
Posts.Title: Drain removal with no pain meds?! Stormynyte SerendipiTea

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2012 11:14PM Mooleen wrote: I got 2 Amoena Style 2105 post op camisoles. It has pouches for the drains. It has fiberfill forms and gives support without restricting you like a bra. I loved it and 8 weeks out am still wearing it. I got it from a local medical supply store. They got an rx from my dr and my insurance covered it. Good luck.
Posts.Title: bilatreral mastectomy next month angiebaby1 Mooleen

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2012 05:27PM Mooleen wrote: In my case, the biopsy is a lumpectomy and I had 2 of them before my dx on the 3rd one. I guess three times a charm--not. I would want it out of me.
Posts.Title: Can i ask for a lumpectomy as a preventive?? domesticwomen BLinthedesert

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2012 04:15PM Mooleen wrote: At first you go to radiology and they guide a wire to the area where the lesion is. No discomfort at all. Then you go under general anestia and when you wake up you will probably have an ice bag on it. They should send you home with hydrocodone. I didn't have much discomfort at all and didn't need the pain meds, but if you are uncomfortable take them. Have ice paks on hand. Good luck. I had this done 3 times. First two were benign. I guess the third time's a charm (not).
Posts.Title: Wire guided biopsy Mon, what to expect? JayeGA gumshoe

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2012 04:24PM Mooleen wrote: I have implants and my tumor was very small and very close to the implant. I had a wire guided surgical lumpectomy and there was never any concern about the implant. It could become a problem, however, if you will need radiation as they can harden. Take one step at a time.
Posts.Title: Anyone with implants had a MR-guided biopsy? BlueSky5 Southbay22

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2012 10:20AM Mooleen wrote: I think what you are experiencing is called a seroma. I had one after my UMX, and it is painful. It was pressing on my ribs. They can aspirate it, but prefer that it reabsorbs itself. Draining it puts you at risk for infection. You definitely need to contact your surgeon.
Posts.Title: Just home from the ER Lynette73 Mooleen

Posts.Content: Mooleen wrote: On February 23 I had a mastectomy and insertion of tissue expander on my left breast. 22 lymph nodes were removed. I am having a complication of seroma, but the tissue is healthy and my PS is not concerned. The pain is improving each week, but I am still very uncomfortable and by afternoon start taking pain pills, which don't help much. The pain is under my arm, which I assume is from the lymph node removal, and around the expander and my ribs. The filling process has not yet started. I would like to hear from others who have had this. How long before the pain goes away? It really wears on you. Can anyone give me your experience with seromas? On a positive note, my lymph nodes were completely clear and I don't require any further cancer treatment. My diagnosis was DCIS Level 3. For this I am grateful as I know I am more fortunate than others. [Edit] [Delete] Dx 11/1/2011, DCIS, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/22 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Surgery 2/23/2012 Lymph node removal: Left, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left Surgery 2/23/2012 Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement Surgery 8/21/2012 Reconstruction (left) Surgery 10/9/2012 Reconstruction (right) Log in to post a reply
